TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit TraceWebEventProvider extends System.Web.Management.WebEventProvider
Public NotInheritable Class TraceWebEventProvider Inherits WebEventProvider
public ref class TraceWebEventProvider sealed : System::Web::Management::WebEventProvider

Docs.summary: Implements an event provider that sends ASP.NET health-monitoring events as trace messages.

remarks.format:
## Remarks ASP.NET health monitoring allows production and operations staff to manage deployed Web applications. The <xref:System.Web.Management?displayProperty=nameWithType> namespace contains the health event types responsible for packaging application health-status data and the provider types responsible for processing this data. It also contains supporting types that help during the management of health events.
This provider passes events to the <xref:System.Diagnostics.Trace> object. It passes events that derive from the <xref:System.Web.Management.WebBaseErrorEvent> class as trace errors and passes all other events as trace information.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.Management.TraceWebEventProvider> object does not provide event buffering.
> [!NOTE] > In most cases you will be able to use the ASP.NET health-monitoring types as implemented, and you will control the health-monitoring system by specifying values in the `healthMonitoring` configuration section. You can also derive from the health-monitoring types to create your own custom events and providers. For an example of creating a custom provider, see [How to: Implement the Health Monitoring Custom Provider Example](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/bbb1c959-e6e4-42b2-be62-49b7ca5ab72c).
## Examples The following configuration file excerpt shows how to specify a provider of type <xref:System.Web.Management.TraceWebEventProvider> in the `healthMonitoring` section. The `add` element in the `rules` section specifies that the provider will handle request-processing events.
``` <healthMonitoring enabled="true" heartBeatInterval="0"> <providers> <add name="TraceEventProvider" type="System.Web.Management.TraceWebEventProvider, System.Web" buffer="false" bufferMode="" maxEventLength="4096" maxSize="4096" maxMessagesPerNotification="1" /> </providers> <eventMappings> <add name="Request Processing Events" type="System.Web.Management.WebRequestEvent, System.Web" /> </eventMappings> <profiles> <add name="Trace" minInstances="1" maxLimit="Infinite" minInterval="00:00:00" /> </profiles> <rules> <add name="Trace Request Processing" eventName="Request Processing Events" provider="TraceEventProvider" profile="Trace" /> </rules> </healthMonitoring> ```

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Flush() cil managed

Docs.summary: Removes all events from the provider's buffer.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is not intended to be used directly from your code. It is called by the ASP.NET health-monitoring system.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventProvider> object does not provide event buffering.

MemberSignature.Value: public override void Initialize (string name, System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection config);
.method public hidebysig virtual instance void Initialize(string name, class System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection config) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub Initialize (name As String, config As NameValueCollection)
public: override void Initialize(System::String ^ name, System::Collections::Specialized::NameValueCollection ^ config);

Docs.param: The name used in the configuration file to identify this provider.
A that specifies the attributes assigned for this provider in the configuration file.
Docs.summary: Sets the initial values for this object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ASP.NET calls the <xref:System.Web.Management.TraceWebEventProvider.Initialize%2A> method to initialize the <xref:System.Web.Management.TraceWebEventProvider> with the configuration settings and name as specified in the configuration file.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void ProcessEvent(class System.Web.Management.WebBaseEvent eventRaised) cil managed
Public Overrides Sub ProcessEvent (eventRaised As WebBaseEvent)

Docs.summary: Processes the event passed to the provider.

remarks.format:
## Remarks This method is not intended to be used directly from your code. It is called by the ASP.NET health-monitoring system.
> [!NOTE] > The <xref:System.Web.Management.WebEventProvider> object does not do event buffering.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance void Shutdown() cil managed

Docs.summary: Performs tasks associated with shutting down the provider.

remarks.format: ## Remarks ASP.NET calls the <xref:System.Web.Management.TraceWebEventProvider.Shutdown%2A> method when the application domain hosting the Web application terminates. The method is called to perform tasks that will allow the application to end gracefully.
